text: At a time of massive income and wealth inequality, am I going to demand that the very rich and large corporations start paying their fair share in taxes? Damn right I am. #SandersTownHall

Tonight, Senate Democrats blocked a vote on the Born-Alive Abortion Survivors Protection Act. It’s unconscionable & inhumane that some in our country, especially members of Congress, are unwilling to take a stand and support the lives of newborns who survive an abortion attempt.

RT @SenTedCruz I was proud to co-sponsor @SenSasse's Born-Alive bill. After the Democrats' actions today, I remain committed to fighting for policies that will protect the lives of the unborn. Every human life is precious, and must be respected as such. #Prolife

RT @CREDOMobile Elizabeth Warren is right — rejecting corporate PAC money alone is far too low a bar to qualify as progressive in 2020. We call on all Presidential candidates to follow her lead, show they’re on the side of working people, and swear off $2,000 per plate fundraisers for good. https://twitter.com/BostonGlobe/status/1100009015252262914 QT @BostonGlobe Senator Elizabeth Warren announces she's rejecting the high-dollar fund-raisers that help power both Democratic and Republican campaigns. http://w.bos.gl/yZ1UhWs

Meeting with Colombian President @IvanDuque & Venezuela’s only legitimate President - @jguaido. It’s time for a free & democratic Venezuela.

"Radical." "Extreme." That's what the ideas we fought for in 2016 were considered back then.

Now those ideas are supported by a majority of Americans. It's time to defeat Donald Trump, complete that revolution and implement the vision we fought for. https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2019/feb/25/its-time-to-complete-the-revolution-we-started

50 years ago, the CEO-to-worker compensation ratio was 20 to 1.

Last year, it was 312 to 1.

While the middle class has been decimated and working people struggle to get by, the rich continue to get richer. Unacceptable.
We shouldn’t be denying our kids the kind of care and early learning they need to fulfill their potential. #UniversalChildCare https://www.nytimes.com/2019/02/21/opinion/warren-child-care.html

We have got to make it clear to Russia that they cannot sabotage elections, not just in the United States, but around the world. That is a serious offense that will not be taken lightly. #SandersTownHall

But I believe the biggest risk in this election is failing to empower the millions of people who feel the squeeze of an economy rigged against them and the deep frustration of a failing political system that produced Donald Trump in the first place. So let’s change it.

As a candidate for president, the expectation is you make hours of calls with wealthy donors a week, and attend dozens of exclusive events every quarter. I told @chrislhayes: I’m saying no to that. This is an equal access campaign for everyone who wants to be part of it. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/D0TDLGEWsAEvqOw.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1100217617544024067/vid/320x180/FtXg_0U-cQedNtwZ.mp4?tag=9

There are some Democrats who are so deeply afraid of losing to Donald Trump that they don’t want to risk saying or doing anything different at all. Even if they agree that we need big, structural change, they see challenging the status quo as an electoral risk.
In just a few minutes, you can catch me on @allinwithchris on @MSNBC. See you soon, @chrislhayes!

Democrats openly deny the concept of the sanctity of life & their actions today did just that. They've chosen to empower & embrace unhinged leftist ideals—like those of disgraced Virginia Gov Northam—which are inhumane & pro-infanticide. These ideals are heartless & unfathomable.

I’ve already said that I'll run my campaign differently – no Washington lobbyist money, no dark money, no super PACs. But today, I’m going further. My presidential primary campaign will be run on the principle of equal access for anybody who joins it.

The national emergency we have is that we don’t have comprehensive immigration reform. The emergency is that we have 1.8 million undocumented young people living in fear they could be deported from the only country they’ve ever known. #SandersTownHall

The day after I announced my candidacy, I shared an incredible letter I received from a young Iowan named Nora, saying I should run for president. 

I was so excited to see Nora and her “Future President” shirt this weekend in Iowa — and hope I get to follow her campaign one day! http://pbs.twimg.com/media/D0ShJ22W0AE9bX5.jpg

I hope and believe that every Democratic candidate will come together after the nominee is selected and make sure Donald Trump is not re-elected. I hope I am the nominee, but if I’m not, I certainly pledge to do that. #SandersTownHall

Our health care system is clearly broken—Americans should not have to make the drastic choice between seeking medical care or considering whether that care will cost too much or result in personal bankruptcy. This is one of the many reasons why we should adopt Medicare for all.

Who we're taking on:

-Insurance companies
-Pharma
-The NRA
-The fossil fuel industry
-The private prison industry
-Wall Street
-The billionaire class

Who's going to win:

-We are.

“Who will bring me down to earth?” Though you soar like the eagle, and your nest is set among the stars, From there I will bring you down.

Obadiah 1:3-4
